alert.note: Alert for Aroostook; Penobscot (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 13 at 5:56PM EDT until August 13 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: The National Weather Service in Caribou Maine has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... East central Aroostook County in northern Maine... North central Penobscot County in east central Maine... * Until 630 PM EDT. * At 555 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Masardis to near Oxbow to 6 miles south of Moosehorn Crossing, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Presque Isle, Mars Hill, Ashland, Easton, Masardis, Mount Chase, Oxbow, Scopan, Dudley Township, Blaine, Westfield, Chapman, Scopan Mountain, Scopan Lake, Squa Pan, Webbertown, Grand Lake Seboeis, Saint Croix, Grand Lake Matagamon and Moro Plantation. This includes the following highways... US Highway 1 between Blaine and Mars Hill. State Highway 11 between Knowles Corner and Squapan. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
